intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. cuspidatum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive lobed shape, and its stems are usually reddish in color. The subspecies cuspidatum is distinguished by its sharp, pointed leaf tips and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
